answers.answer: Only a doctor through the appropriate test can answer your questions.Its not unusual for levels to fluctuate due to many various reasons.Perhaps your dose is still not correct.  There are ways to take pills that might compensate. For instance, alternation two different dosages, taking one dose skipping days, splitting pills, etc.  You didn't give much information to go on/by.You might give an endo. a try.  Then, if and when your thyroid issue is resolved, you can go by to original doctor.

ANYTHING is possible.If your doctor is stumped, maybe it is time for him to refer you to an Endocrinologist. Ask him to pick one that is not specializing in Diabetes. Some Endo's are not well versed on thyroid issues.
My levels were doing the same, I got referred to an endo, and got properly diagnosed/treated.

question: I was diagnosed as hypothyroid a year ago.  I have been battling multiple symptoms and my levels are up and down.  My Syntrhoid doses have been raised and lowered and my levels have drastically fluctuated.  My doctor (GP) is stumped.  Should I go to an endocrinologist?  Is there a chance I have thyroid/adrenal issues combined and/or an autoimmune disease?  I have bladder intersitial cystitis....HELP!
title: Meds not working
